article_title: Puerto Rico Plays Chicken With Its Creditors
article_text:
On Sept. 1 the state-owned Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority (Prepa) faces a deadline for restructuring more than $8 billion in debt. If it can’t come to an agreement with creditors, a previous forbearance agreement will expire and the company will face default.

In that event, bondholders could be expected to go to court to begin the process of receivership, as the bond contracts stipulate.

This high-stakes negotiation...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Americas columnist Mary O’Grady says Puerto Rico is playing chicken with its creditors and the failure to negotiate in good faith may cost it the help it needs from Washington.
twitter.title: Puerto Rico Plays Chicken With Its Creditors

image.alt: Puerto Rico Plays Chicken With Its Creditors
